text: The bulgogi is so delicious and well cooked and the fish and chips are on point with their yummy fry sauce. Best place to go to while in North Las Vegas

So this is a mom and pop place in a not so great neighborhood.  We decided to give it a try since our favorite Korean place closed down and it is close to Nellis Base.  The name implies that they are known for fish and chips?  We didn't try it but maybe we should have.  The place is small ( only 5 tables).  Very amateur decor.  They were friendly enough.  They do make food as you order and only take cash.  We ordered fried wontons, egg rolls, spicy pork bulgogi, and mild beef bulgogi.  The wontons weren't Very flavorful.  The egg rolls were mushy and bland.  The bulgogi was just ok.  Barely.  We have been to Korea and this just wasn't good.  It was $40 for both of us.  A bit high for low quality.  We will continue our search for good Korean food.
Just introduced to this place.  Great chicken bulgogi!!!  I got it at a medium.  Good spice, but I will try the hot next time.  I'll be back.

I love this hole in the wall Korean joint!  I have only ordered one dish from there and that's all I really need.  The Beef Bulgogi is amazing!  I get it spicy with noodles instead of rice.  Definitely worth a visit.
One of my favorite lunch places when I'm on the area. They have a nice variety of food. My favorite is the combination fried rice. Everything is made to order and prices are reasonable.

A-OK.

First and foremost, this is a Korean restaurant, but supposedly, they do have fish and chips.  Secondly, and equally important, is that this is a cash only establishment.  Now it's no secret that I'm especially critical of Asian cuisine.  It's not that I'm that much of a connoisseur (I wish); it's that my expectations have grown to be that high.  Don't let my rating fool you away from this establishment.

I also need to curb my enthusiasm some because I'm such a big fan of mom & pop restaurants.  This place quite literally is only that: pop serving up front and mom cooking in the back.  That fact alone makes me giddy about this place.  The locale has something to be desired, but as a lunch option, it's nothing scary.  Also, for being cash only, I thought this place was kind of pricey.  Entr√©e portion size wasn't too bad, but the kimchi selection was definitely sub-par.  Luckily, it was all friggin' delicious.

I got the pork bul go gi.  Those unfamiliar: it's Korean BBQ.  Those familiar: no, they don't have the DIY grills -- it's served already cooked on a cast-iron hot-plate.  They offer in mild, medium, or hot.  The hot will get your attention, but I recommend going for medium and supplementing with the hot sauce they have at the table.  I swear they must lace that sauce with something-something because it's that awesome.  The food is all made to order by the one-woman-team, which means in a group, someone will get their food before someone else.  She doesn't make it all at once, and he doesn't wait until the whole order is ready.  Yet that signifies how freshly the food is prepared.  Service was prompt, courteous, and friendly, with the language barrier not really an issue.

Places like this seem to be a rarity in Vegas, so I highly encourage local support.  At least give it a shot.  I yearn to find more places like this, but in the mean time, I'll probably be back here.
Amazing Korean food, however they are known for thier fish and chips..  it's a bit pricey but overall very good.
After living in Korea and living off bulgogi I must say there beef bulgogi is the best I've had.

Been there many times and never had anything but good food! The person that said that the Bulgogi was so-so must have killed their taste buds......best in town, and we have tried almost all of em. This is their 3 rd location over 20 years so they must be doing something right! Cash only, terrible location, and other drawbacks, but worth the drive for us from Summerlin.

My boyfriend and I were looking for a Chinese restaurant near the base. He found this on Yelp and yes, this place offers delicious Chinese, Korean cuisines and fish and chips! Make sure to bring cash :) but it's worth it. The foods are fresh and delicious. It's not expensive!!!
No frills Kalbi plate. Two scoops of rice and bb short ribs Korean style. $12. Korean fast food joint poising as a fish and chips place. Tasty but average. Probably go back.

Came back last friday to try the Kimchi Soup. It wasn't spicy enough and the beef was a little touch. It comes with rice and I was stuffed.

I think I'll try the Short Ribs next time.

It's kinda hard to find mom and pop shops in North Las Vegas. So as soon as me and a couple friends came across this, we had to try it. 

I got the 2 Fish 2 chicken and chips plate. It was pretty good, but I think it needs a little more seasoning for it to stand out more. Definitely better than Long John Silvers that's for sure. They serve Korean and Chinese, too. Might have to give those a try next time.

*first *

Fish and chips? Korean food? Chinese food? On las vegas Blvd? Ooooooooooo k?

Walking in, it's everything you expect. Plastic cheap chairs and tables. Ripped up posters on the wall. A big ass crab hung on the wall. It's definitely a ma & pop restaurant. 

I ordered a beef bulgogi (bul kogi in their menu) and it was delicious. The spiciness was perfect and the taste was sweet. They don't give you enough rice though. I definitely had way more beef than rice. 

Bulgogi -4/5

Price is iffy. $12 for a bulgogi plate? With 2 tiny scoops of rice? 

Price 3/5

I will be back to try more on their menu though... It's good enough for now!

They are super nice people.  Its a fish and chips place.  its good food.  but it the food your going for not the ambiance.

it is pretty good for a fish place in the pink mans desert.

So I been going to USS Fish N Chips for 5 years and I have brought in many coworkers just because their bulgogi and short ribs was AMAZING. This Friday I have decided to no go back ever again. I got my usual order of bulgogi and my meat tasted funny it didn't look the same and it was PINK! I even asked my coworker was hers good  and she said no and agreed that she also thinks my meat was pink. I tell the couple and they recooked my meat. Between then I saw them heating up a customers food in a microwave before my food was returned to me. It was still gross so I waited until no customers around to ask for a refund. I got a refund but was met with an attitude and them proceeding to talk about me while I was still there. I can't believe they would act like that when I was a loyal customer and brought new customers to them. I'm so disappointed in this place.

My parents have been going here since I was little, when they use to have their old location on lake mead.  I still love the food here.  Can't go wrong with he fish and chips or the bi bim bap. Make sure you have cash on you because they don't take cards. Call ahead and make your order and it will be done in less than 20 minutes... Mine always is.

First time here and I was happily satisfied...
I've drove by before always seemed closed finally on this day I drive by and happen to see someone going in . Made a quick turn and walked on in .... people had been telling us about this spot since we've been looking for a fish and chips place . The batter was just right and golden brown . Chips was plenty and yummy . Will come back and try some Korean food since it looked so yummy.

This place is good! 
I just came from South Korea and their kailbi ribs are delicious. I loved their fried rice and their catfish with chips were yummy too. Prices are great!

I absolutely love this place!!!! I use to go to the original one since I was 3. When they closed the first restaurant I was heart broken because I thought they were done for good. Thanks to YELP because  I found them again and I've been going back ever since. I love LOVE love the fish and chips, and shrimp fried rice. It takes me back to being a kid again.
If you have ever lived up north, bordering Canada, don't go to this place for fish and chips. I tasted no fish, just batter. Very disappointing.

Welcome to Dan's adventures in the ghetto. A friend and I decided that we needed to explore the options in our work neighborhood (emphasis on 'hood').  Our first pick, USS Fish and Chips.  

I'm not a big fish and chips person.  Most of the fish and chips dishes I have tried have been soggy, dry, or just plain nasty.  Even though USS is a Korean restaurant, I decided to try their claim to fame cuisine.  A big plate of 3 big fish strips and potato wedges costed about $6.75.  I was completely blown away.  This was the best fish and chips I think I have ever had!  They were pleasantly fried, not too thick and greasy.  The fish was tasty on it's own, but even tastier with some malt vinegar and tarter sauce.  The potato wedges were shaped like little chips, about a centimeter thick. They were light and fluffy, but meaty at the same time.

You don't come to USS for the atmosphere.  You probably don't come for the gourmet service either.  You may have to dodge the occasional drug dealer or hobo, but for a decent fish and chip dish it is worth it.  Pleasantly surprised.  I would return.  Beware of the Cash Only policy.

Yet another decent hole in the wall/mom and pop type of place to check out if you're in the area! Before you come here, let be known that its CASH ONLY!

Just like any new place I check out I usually go with the namesake of the place if it applies. So what I got was the Fish, Chicken, and Chips Combo ($8.25). 

You get two pieces of battered fish and chicken along with potato chips. The fish was tender and flaky. The chicken was bit chewy because it was a bit dry. The potato chips are comparable nilla wafers thicknesswise but were just a tad bigger. Im thinking if dude  makes it with some kind of seasoning, it would surely be a hit for it was already decent the way it was.

If you refer to my pic, when the guy brings it out to you on a tray, it comes complete with ranch, ketchup, tartar sauce, and hot sauce. That's awesome! You have all the condiments you need!

While I was eating, I noticed that other people that came in ordered Korean dishes mainly Bulgogi and Kim Chi Soup. Man, all it did was give me more incentive to come back and order those very same items. Oh, before I forget, this place is an American/Korean/Chinese type of cuisine. 

So basically, you can eat here every day for about 6 months and not have the same thing. Here are just some of the things that you would probably catch your eye after looking over the menu. Frog Legs, Oxtail Soup, Fried Pineapple, Kalbi Short Ribs, and Deep Fried Eggplant.

Minus 1 star because of the cash only policy and the location. Quick story. As I park my car and get out, this guy comes out of nowhere asking me if I wanted to buy some weed from him. I said, no thanks, I am here for the fish and chips. He responded with oh yeah, the fish and chips are bomb here. Then off he went like nothing happened.

In closing, food and service here is great. I just dont think coming here at night would be a good idea especially if you are alone. Which reminds me. The business hours are Monday thru Saturday 10:30 am to 8 pm. Closed sundays. These guys are located in a strip mall on the corner of Las Vegas Blvd and Cheyenne Ave. Check them out.

Yelp 2014 365 Review Challenge #129 "Fish n Chips and other stuff"
Was my usual place for fish and chips because it's close and well was good but the last few times I've gone in the food has been disappointing.

Great place, the couple that works there is super friendly. The only thing that disappoints me about this place is the fact that they ONLY take CASH as a form of payment. No credit cards or debit cards. But the fish n chips are on point, the bulgogi is out of this world and the short ribs are something special.

Ate there today for the first time.  My husband is stationed at Nellis.  Awesome mom & pop shop.  Yes, cash only!!  I had the bibimbap and it was delicious.  My husband always gets the chicken bulgogi--also delicious.  A little pricey but definitely worth the trip!

Place is very easy to pass by but I found this place on Yelp and glad I did very decent priced for seafood. Was not too oily and tasted fresh. I will definitely go every time I am here in Vegas for local eats. Try the fried Pineapple yummy!

To review or not review? This place is run by an older couple. I feel like if too many people hear about this place, they'll just get overwhelmed with how much they have to do. While we were there, they served about 9 people over the course of 40 minutes...which seems to be about the right cadence for them. Any more and it might be overwhelming?

Fish and chips are actually great! So is the tofu soup. Table next to us got bulgogi and they loved it. 

Place is a little dumpy and I'm assuming most of their business is take out. But the food is good at a fair price.
Love this place. Best Kimchee anywhere! Yummy beef bulgogi! Wonderful mom and pop place....we've never had a bad meal from here!

I love this place! The Korean food is amazing. I love the bim bim bap and the kimchi soup is excellent! This husband and wife team have been serving great food for a long time. I followed them from Lake Mead blvd and have eaten their food for years. Such a great couple!
I eat here every Friday and get the beef bulgogi, after the first time I had went, all of my co workers wanted some too. It's now become a Friday must have for everyone in the shop.

I took a recommendation from my coworker and decided to come here for lunch. I was a bit skeptical considering the location it was in but the diviest food is usually the best right? 

For ambiance alone I would have to give this place a 2 star. They're definitely not a normal sit down restaurant. The drinks are in a cooler on the side wall and you walk up to the man at the counter who writes your order down in a notebook. There's not much talking involved so it's a bit confusing as to how the service is supposed to go. Almost more of a self serve type of place, but the food is legit.

I had the beef Bulgogi which came hot and fresh with a side of steamed rice. I got it a medium spicy which was just right and the portion side was very good for the price. 

Overall I would try this place again but only for take out. This is certainly not somewhere I would want to hang around and enjoy my food.

Dont let the door or front scare ya lol...this is a lil hole in the wall wasnt expecting this but its a nice  lil tasty spot i will defently be comming alsome to have a lil rice bowl spot like this here in north vegas :D

USS Fish N Chips is tucked away in a strip row of stores along northern Las Vegas Blvd in which most of the signs are in strictly Spanish, which didn't bode well of a Korean food place...nor did the name of the place indicate any Asia relation at all.  So, if you can find it, you'll be greeted by a friendly Korean family and their great food.  I did not have any fish-and-chips...and didn't see them on the menu come to think of it, but that all disappeared when the food arrived steaming hot and tasty.
This will definitely be on the lunch place cycle, but I'm not sure I'd try it out after dark since most of the neighboring establishments are embellished with quite the assortment of bars on the windows.

I went for lunch, it's very hard to find variety for lunch near Nellis. After reading reviews I decided to for with the Bulgogi. I felt like it was just okay. The price I felt was unwarranted, 11.88 (cash only). While I feel like I would go back and try other items, will be my last time ordering this dish.
Love this Korean food place!! Any dish from there menu will not disappoint you. Try them you wont regret it.

Had the tempura shrimp and chips, it was awesome.   Also had a side of wings, I didn't care for them so much...a bit dry and overcooked.   Good flavor though.  I came back the next day for lunch and had spicy beef bulgoki.  It was awesome!   I plan to come back tomorrow and try the curry chicken.

This little clean hole in the wall fish and chips joint is outstanding. The fish was white and flaky with light batter. Crispy and was fried in obviously clean/fresh oil. The chips were mandoline sliced fresh and also seemed lightly battered or floured. Overall the whole box meal was delicious and i will be back!

Had a poor experience here.  Several people ahead of us were waiting for their orders when we came in.  Ordered 4 lunches, $37.50.  Several customers that ordered after us got their food as we waited.  The guy who took our order assured us our food was coming. After 30 minutes, we heard our order getting started. Really.  We cancelled and got our money back.  He also ran off another customer who asked what kind of fish they served. His answer was regular fish, and he basically ran her off. Pretty amazing. If you see a line, expect to wait. Poor customer relations. Huge language barrier.

First time here. So nothing to compare to.
Food was HOT and fresh. Taste was good. 
Atmosphere is very casual and small. Must come early because there is t a lot of room. Mom and pop place, they do everything! Love a business like this. 

**cash only**

I come here for lunch once in a while when I'm at work and craving korean food, it is relatively close to Nellis and the food is good. The other Korean restaurants are too far in spring mountain so this location is perfect, and the owners are really nice people. Food is very filling. Beware, they are cash only and the location is pretty ghetto.

Ignacio wanted chinese & of course I wanted Fried food so off to yelp & found this place based on the reviews.  It is a true Mom & pop.  I had the fish & chips and Ignacio have the Korean Beef Bul Gogi.  They only have can/bottle soda and juices so we shared a bottle of pepsi.  We asked for cups with ice and mom provided them for the asking.  We sat at 1 of 6-7 tables and pop comes with a tray full of all the condiments and sauces that you would ever want for your meal.  Shortly after we sat our food came out.  Ignacio loved the big bowl of rice and a sizzling skillet of beef Bul Gogi.  His first time having it and he said he would def come back again for the same thing.  I had 3 pieces of fish & fries.  The fist was a very thin filet with a great crispy & flaky batter.  The fries were a thick waffle cut and were also nice and crisp just the way I like them. Tarter sauce was obviously home made with lots of pickle and was in a huge squeeze bottle.  There was also a fish sauce if you wanted that instead.  I posted pics of the menu and we will be coming back to this place soon to try something new.
Pop said to call in our order and it would be on the table when we got here the next time.
I love their food they're very nice people and hardworking people the food is great you have to go and see them

So i just went to us fish and chips to buy some food ! This lady had rice just sitting out with nothing covering i over looked that then i see her grab meat with a dirty a** glove with red stuff on it then go in th back fridge and grab a silver container that wasn't covered no dates or nothing so i say excuse me are you gonna change your gloves you just touched raw meat and i definitely don't want that ish on my food . Then she says it the same as at home ? Tf first of all i don't cook like that i wash my hands after touching meat because it's feels nasty and second of all this is a restaurant you definitely don't tell me that she was like well take your money back and "GET THE F*CK OUT" so all the people behind me were like eww i don't wanna eat here either so they closed the doors an hour early all because she didn't wanna server food the right way . This is exactly why i cook at home ? u.s.s fish n chips
